parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The malfunction of the Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) can cause the vehicle to pull to one side, skid, or lock up, leading to accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: The vehicle pulls to the right or left when applying brakes
the vehicle skids or locks up
the ABS system disengages for a short distance
the brakes feel like they are dragging
and the smell of burning brakes is present.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent failure of the windshield wipers can reduce visibility during rainy or snowy conditions, increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: sometimes functioning normally and other times not working at all

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Exhaust fumes entering the vehicle can cause health problems, including headaches, dizziness, and nausea, and can lead to carbon monoxide poisoning in severe cases.
symptoms: Unpleasant odors or fumes inside the vehicle
visible smoke or fog inside the vehicle
or nausea while driving or riding in the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Excessive Oil Consumption and Poor Fuel Economy
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive oil consumption can lead to premature engine wear, increased maintenance costs, and decreased fuel efficiency, which can result in increased emissions and environmental harm.
